Super nitpicky - since both paths (status >= 400 and status OK) call await response.json(), it's a liiiiittle DRYer to pull the const token = await response.json(); declaration above the if statement, like so:

const jsonResponse = await response.json();
if(response.status >= 400){
  //...
  throw jsonResponse;
}

dispatch({
  // ..
  token: jsonResponse,
})
